Package farm.game

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • farm.game.GameEnvironment
  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class implements the game environment which contains all of the game logic. This environment implements all of the functions required to play the farm simulation game, whilst keeping track of a farm and the elapsed days. The game instantiates all classes used.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Megan Steenkamp

      • setUpGame

        public void setUpGame​(int numDays,
                      java.lang.String farmType,
                      java.lang.String farmerName,
                      int farmerAge,
                      java.lang.String farmName)
        Initialize the game.
        Parameters:
        numDays - Chosen duration of the game in days.
        farmType - The name of the selected farm subclass.
        farmerName - The name of the farmer.
        farmerAge - The age of the farmer.
        farmName - The name of the farm.

      • beginNewDay

        public void beginNewDay()
        Begins a new day on the farm by incrementing the current day and resetting the allowed actions. Crop growth is also updated by one day.

      • getDayWelcomeMessage

        public java.lang.String getDayWelcomeMessage()
        Returns a welcome message for the beginning of a day.
        Returns:
        A message to begin a new day on the farm.

      • getDailyBonus

        public java.lang.String getDailyBonus()
        Calculates a daily bonus for the farm depending on animal happiness and health and adds this to the balance of the farm. A description of the bonus earned is returned.
        Returns:
        A String representation of the monetary bonus for the day.

      • setNumDays

        public void setNumDays​(int days)
        Sets the number of days the game will last for.
        Parameters:
        days - The number of days the game should last.

      • getDaysTotal

        public int getDaysTotal()
        Returns the total number of days the game will last for.
        Returns:
        Total game duration in days.

        Returns:

        Returns:

        public int getNumActions()
        Returns the number of actions that the player still has for the given day.
        Returns:
        Number of allowed actions remaining.

      • moveToNextDay

        public boolean moveToNextDay()
        Moves to the next day of the game if the game is not finished. If the game is finished, the function will return false indicating that the game is completed.
        Returns:
        Returns true if a new day has begun. Returns false if the game is completed.

      • getCropTendingDescription

        public java.lang.String getCropTendingDescription()
        Returns a description of the 'tend to crops' action, performed by a farmer.
        Returns:
        The description of tending to crops.

        Returns a description of the 'harvest crops' action, performed by a farmer.
        Returns:
        A description of harvesting crops.

        Returns a description of the 'tend to the farm land' action, performed by a farmer.
        Returns:
        A description of tending to farmland.

      • canTendToCrops

        public boolean canTendToCrops()
        Returns true if a farmer is able to tend to the crops. This will be true if there are crops on the farm.
        Returns:
        True if the crops can be tended to. Else, false.

      • canFeedAnimals

        public boolean canFeedAnimals()
        Returns true is a farmer can feed the animals. This will be true if there are animals on the farm and the farmer has some food items.
        Returns:
        True if the animals can be fed. Else, false.

      • canPlayWithAnimals

        public boolean canPlayWithAnimals()
        Returns true if a farmer can play with the animals. This requires the farm to have animals.
        Returns:
        True if there are animals on the farm. Else, false.

      • canHarvestCrops

        public boolean canHarvestCrops()
        Returns true if a farmer has crops that are ready to be harvested.
        Returns:
        True if there are crops ready to harvest. Else, false.

      • getFoodItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<FarmItem> getFoodItems()
        Returns food items owned by the farmer.
        Returns:
        Food items owned by the farmer.

      • getToolItems

        public java.util.ArrayList<FarmItem> getToolItems()
        Returns items used for tending to crops owned by the farmer.
        Returns:
        Items used for tending to crops owned by the farmer.

      • getCrops

        public java.util.ArrayList<FarmItem> getCrops()
        Returns all crops on the farm.
        Returns:
        Crops on the farm.

      • tendToCrops

        public java.lang.String tendToCrops​(int cropId,
                                    int itemId)
        Implements the 'tend to crops' action using an item.
        Parameters:
        cropId - The type ID of the crop to be tended to.
        itemId - The type ID of the item to be used for tending to the crops.
        Returns:
        The updated status of the crops.

      • tendToCrops

        public java.lang.String tendToCrops​(int cropId)
        Implements the 'tend to crops' action using the free option, 'water'. This deducts one day off the required crop growth.
        Parameters:
        cropId - The type ID of the crop to be tended to.
        Returns:
        The updated status of the crops.

      • feedAnimals

        public java.lang.String feedAnimals​(int itemId)
        Implements the 'feed animals' action using a food item. This improves the health of all animals.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The Type ID of the food item to use to feed the animals.
        Returns:
        The updated status of all animals.

      • playWithAnimals

        public java.lang.String playWithAnimals()
        Implements the 'play with animals' action which improves the happiness of animals.
        Returns:
        The updated status of all animals.

      • harvestCrops

        public java.lang.String harvestCrops()
        Implements the 'harvest crops' action which adds the selling price of harvested crops to the balance of the farm, and frees a crop plot up for every harvested crop. Harvested crops are removed from the crop list.
        Returns:
        An updated status of the crops.

      • tendToFarmland

        public java.lang.String tendToFarmland()
        Implements the 'tend to the farm land' action which adds to animal happiness.
        Returns:
        The updated status of the animals.

      • displayCurrentlyOwnedItems

        public java.lang.String displayCurrentlyOwnedItems()
        Returns the balance of the farm and items currently owned by the farmer.
        Returns:
        The balance of the farm and items currently owned by the farmer.

      • getNumAvailableCrops

        public int getNumAvailableCrops()
        Returns the number of available crop plots on the farm.
        Returns:
        Number of available crop plots on the farm.

      • processAnimalSale

        public FarmItem processAnimalSale​(int itemId)
        Processes the purchase of an animal from the store. This involves firstly withdrawing money from the farm. If this is successful the animal will be purchased and added to the farm's animal list.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The Type ID of the animal to be sold.
        Returns:
        The animal if it has been successfully purchased. Otherwise it will return null.

      • processCropSale

        public FarmItem processCropSale​(int itemId)
        Processes the purchase of a crop from the store. This involves firstly withdrawing money from the farm. If this is successful the crop will be purchased and added to the farm's crop list.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The Type ID of the crop to be sold.
        Returns:
        The crop if it has been successfully purchased. Otherwise it will return null.

      • processItemSale

        public FarmItem processItemSale​(int itemId)
        Processes the purchase of a farming item from the store. This involves firstly withdrawing money from the farm. If this is successful the item will be purchased and added to the farmer's list of items.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The Type ID of the item to be sold.
        Returns:
        The item if it has been successfully purchased. Otherwise it will return null.

      • getFarmItemDescription

        public java.lang.String getFarmItemDescription​(int itemId)
        Returns the default description of an item.
        Parameters:
        itemId - The type ID of the item to be described.
        Returns:
        The description of the given item.

      • getSuccessMessage

        public java.lang.String getSuccessMessage​(FarmItem item)
        Returns a generic success message when any farm item is purchased.
        Parameters:
        item - The item that has been successfully purchased.
        Returns:
        A success message.

      • getErrorMessage

        public java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
        Returns a default error message if a purchase has been unsuccessful.
        Returns:
        A default error message.

      • getTotalProfit

        public float getTotalProfit()
        Returns the profit that has been made throughout the duration of the game.
        Returns:
        The total profit made during the game.

      • calculateFinalScore

        public int calculateFinalScore()
        Calculate a final score based on game duration, number of crops and animals, animal status and money earned
        Returns:
        Final game score.

      • getFinalResults

        public java.lang.String getFinalResults()
        Return a string summarizing the final results for a game.
        Returns:
        The final summary of the game.
